lines.text: Hey, maybe it's a giraffe, the giraffe!
Nah, that ain't no giraffe. A giraffe's got a long neck like this

[as they all jump on top of Bugs]
Dog pile on the rabbit! Dog pile on the rabbit! Dog pile on the rabbit!...

[Hopping on top of the dog pile]
Dog pile on the rabbit! Dog pile on the rabbit! Dog pile on the rabbit!

[as Spike is hanging by his fingers on the clothesline, Bugs proceeds to loosen each finger]
Mhm... this wittle piddy went to market... this wittle piddy stayed home... this wittle piggy had roast beef.
Well, what do you know, ran out of piddies! Gee, ain't I a stinker?
Did he had long ears, a fuzzy tail, and hop around like this?
And is there a tough-looking mug chasing him, with a derby,
And when you ain't looking, does he let you have it like this?
Yeah, that's the guy! That's the... Hey, wait a minute! Which way did he go?
So there I was, trapped, overwhelmed by superior numbers.
My goodness, Bugs. How did you ever get out of that one?
Well, I grabbed the nearest thing I could get my hands on, determined to make their victory a costly one.
Bugs grabs a book to throw at the dogs; the dogs see the cover and run across the Brooklyn Bridge; Bugs looks at the cover, which reads "A Tree Grows in Brooklyn"]
Hey, you know? Maybe I ought to read this thing.

[Spike has chased him into an automat]
Hey, got a nickel, Mac?
[Bugs gets a piece of pie and hits Spike in the face with it]
Oh, I'm awfully sorry. I've made a terrible mistake. You wanted...
